text: RE: Microsoft stop messing with my people's task bar settings. NOTE: The first time I sent this it was rejected by Google Groups on grounds that it was "spam" sent as "bulk mail". That's the first time that's happened to me here. I snipped a bunch of extraneous stuff from this version and I hope it will get through. -- Ken Dibble -- ORIGINAL MESSAGE -- Susan, We are here to manage, and also to inform Microsoft about problems created by that company that confound our ability to manage. Microsoft has people who sit on this group. Patch management is supposed to be a "partnership" between customers and Microsoft. It is not supposed to be a dictatorship, in which Microsoft dictates and the peons are told to stop whinging (a British term that I like) and just "manage". It's my expectation that Microsoft would exhibit appropriate respect for the knowledge and experience of the people gathered here, which includes, apparently, some highly qualified experts who work for some of the largest corporations and organizations on the planet. That makes this forum one of the best opportunities available to provide feedback. Thanks for saying what you've said. Ken Dibble www.stic-cil.org At 01:00 PM 10/13/2023, Susan Bradley wrote: %40gmr-mx.google.com
